CatDescriptText: Mr. William F. Staider, 564 Dugan Way, New Kensington, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Federal Government should provide financial aid for students of exceptional ability to further their education when the students are unable to do so for themselves?" answer reads: "I do, provided that those people, who get the aid pay it back. It should not be a subsidy of 100 per cent.  And it should not be gratis."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William F. Staider wearing dark hat with woven band, light colored overcoat, and dark tie with small embroidered pattern, standing in front of flecked granite wall
